text: Former headquarters of the SAB in Dresden Site of the new headquarters building under construction in Leipzig The Development Bank of Saxony (known as SAB from the German name Sächsische Aufbaubank) was founded in 1991http://www.sab.sachsen.de/de/sab/ueberblick/ and is the state development institution for the state of Saxony, Germany. ==Activities== The Development Bank of Saxony allocates subsidies e.g. from the European Regional Development Fund in the form of grants, sureties and loans into various sectors of the economy e.g. technology, as well as into residential and municipal construction. In the business year 2016, the bank made over 50,000 payments and grants totalling almost 1.4 billion euro and loans of over 450 million euro.https://www.sab.sachsen.de/die-sab/pressemitteilungen/presse- detail_64768.jsp ==Location== The headquarters of the Development Bank of Saxony is in Leipzig since January 2017, although the headquarters building will not be completed until 2019.http://www.lvz.de/Leipzig/Lokales/Saechsische-Aufbaubank-startet- spektakulaeren-Neubau-in-diesem- Jahrhttps://www.tag24.de/nachrichten/kostenexplosion-beim-leipziger-sab- neubau-jetzt-wehrt-sich-die-saechsische-aufbaubank-227480 The bank also has customer centers in Leipzig and Chemnitz and regional offices in Plauen, Annaberg-Buchholz, Torgau and Görlitz. == History == From 1991 until 1995 the L-Bank, the state development bank of Baden-Württemberg, operated the bank. Then on December 19, 1995 the SAB GmbH was created as a subsidiary of the L-Bank. This took up the operation on June 1, 1996. Since December 30, 2002 the SAB is a 100% subsidy of the state of Saxony.http://www.sab.sachsen.de/de/sab/ueberblick/ In 2003 its legal form was changed into an Institution under Public Law (de: Anstalt des öffentlichen Rechts). ==References== Category:Banks of Germany Category:Economy of Saxony
title: Development Bank of Saxony
